full_state.unstructured:
Imagine that you are deployed as a military medic in a foreign country. You arrive at a scene where you know there may be multiple casualties. It will be at least 30 minutes before any casualty can be evacuated and you are the only medic available.
The first casualty you come upon has a dislocated left shoulder with no bleeding. 
As you finish performing the most immediate treatment on your current patient, you hear someone who is crying or screaming out of sight.
Do you continue treating your current patient, or do you move to find and treat a different patient?
